## Overview
#### Project Purpose
- Solve the inconvenience of encountering unknown words upon reading an English passage and having to look up elsewhere.

#### Feature Highlight
- Read multiple professional-written passages fetched via New York Times API with a juxtaposed dictionary to facilitate English learning.
- Responsive design fitting for all mobile devices.


<br/>

## Workings Outline

1. The input search keyword will serve as the value to the property name of searchTerm, which corresponds to the URL specification for the New York Times API.

2. The fetched passages, along with the images coming with the texts, will be shown in the main display panel.

3. Every word within the given passages is clickable. Once it's clicked, another HTTP GET request will be sent with the intended word serving as the URL parameter for the Free Dictionary API.

4. The fetched definition, part of speech, and usage example, will be displayed in the dictionary panel.

5. All the fetched data through NTY and Free Dictionary APIs are stored in the Redux's state container, after which, dependent upon different scenarios, respective React components are allowed to make use of the handled data.


 
<br/>

## Setup 

 - ####  Clone the project
```
git clone https://github.com/laynesquare/learn_english_with_dictionary.git
```

 - #### Register an NYT API key and set it to the process environment variable

```
process.env.NYT_API_KEY
```
<div align="center">

[![Register an API key for NYT](https://img.shields.io/badge/Register%20an%20NYT%20API%20key-c26048?style=for-the-badge)](https://developer.nytimes.com/accounts/create)
 
</div>

- ####  Under the respective client/server folder
```
npm install
npm run start
```
